meanings.sent1: She decided to apholate herself from the noisy crowd.

meanings.sent3: The cat apholated itself in the cozy corner of the room.
meanings.sent4: The artist apholated the main character in a spotlight of colors.

meanings.sent1: He used a tool to apholate the wires safely.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic had to apholate the engine parts for repair.

meanings.sent4: The storm apholated the island from the mainland with a flood.

meanings.definition: To exclude or remove from a group or situation
meanings.sent1: The team captain had to apholate the player for breaking the rules.
meanings.sent2: The teacher had to apholate the distracting student from the class.
meanings.sent3: The judge apholated the biased juror from the trial.
meanings.sent4: The security guard apholated the intruder from entering the building.
meanings.sent5: The manager apholated the troublemaker from the project team.
